name: multiplicative
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mathematics
  specialized relating to multiplication (= the process of adding a number to itself a particular number of times): The arguments may be followed by multiplicative suffixes such as KiB (=1024) and MiB (=1024*1024). The outcome according to the multiplicative rule would be x a +(- b) or x a-b.
formal increasing more and more over time: Oppression can have multiplicative effects. You can take advantage of this multiplicative power of networks.
More examplesFewer examplesWe assume that the state 0 is not multiplicative.Level 1 actions tend to be additive, while Level 2 actions tend to be multiplicative.In cases like these the effect of the two events is multiplicative.Rutter et al. (1975) found a multiplicative increase in the rates of externalizing problems as a function of the number of risk factors present across the several domains.
